body:
I think I got a workaround for now. Would certainly prefer the plugin to allow unofficial, but hey progress not perfection

```sh
#!/bin/sh
# This script downloads the nodejs archive into the Maven local repository so that
# frontend-maven-plugin can work on Alpine/musl. It mostly plays tricks to get rid
# of '-musl' in both the archive name and its contents.
#
# See https://github.com/eirslett/frontend-maven-plugin/pull/853
set -eux

# Get the version of node our build wants.
NODE_VERSION=$(mvn -pl zipkin-lens help:evaluate -Dexpression=node.version -q -DforceStdout)

# Get a local path corresponding to the Maven artifact the frontend-maven-plugin expects
NODE_MAVEN_PATH=~/.m2/repository/com/github/eirslett/node/${NODE_VERSION}/node-${NODE_VERSION}-linux-x64.tar.gz

if [ ! -f "${NODE_MAVEN_PATH}" ]; then
  # Get the URL of the unofficial build of musl
  NODE_DOWNLOAD_URL=https://unofficial-builds.nodejs.org/download/release/v${NODE_VERSION}/node-v${NODE_VERSION}-linux-x64-musl.tar.gz
  echo "*** Downloading nodejs into the Maven local repository"

  # Strip '-musl' from the original archive's file paths
  mkdir /tmp/$$ && cd /tmp/$$
  wget -qO- ${NODE_DOWNLOAD_URL}| tar --transform 's/-musl//' -xz

  # Create a new archive where Maven would expect it
  mkdir -p $(dirname "${NODE_MAVEN_PATH}")
  tar -czf ${NODE_MAVEN_PATH} *
fi
```

I will merge once local build finishes.

The first time I need to push the builder update to dockerhub kindof exactly when this merges :D
ok watching master build...

It looks like this is a problem with safari (I'm using Mac).

When the same page is opened in chrome, all the data is there.

By looking at the source code of the generated html page in safari, i noticed that the data and the elements are all there, they are just not showing up.

Summary: in this cases, there is a missing exclude (you can check the sleuth issue list) resulting in junk single-span traces. It is true the UI should show them anyway, but there is enough information to solve this now, thanks.

Help wanted! this is a volunteer run project.

At any rate, I highly suggest looking at docs and/or raising an issue with sleuth so that these junk traces don't pollute your data store and UI, once the UI is fixed to show them

sorry @DriesCleymans I misread your input as I read the older message. Your analysis is quite helpful and can allow this to be narrowed down quicker.  We don't have browser tests on safari, so would need to catch this manually I suppose.
https://github.com/eirslett/frontend-maven-plugin/pull/934 should make it nicer

Yeah, definitively a good optimization.

On Sat, 3 Oct 2020, 10:23 Adrian Cole, <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> The .git folder on a default clone copies 77MB into the Docker context. We
> only need it for the git-commit-id-plugin, which replaces
> @git.commit.id.abbrev@ in a couple files in the zipkin-server directory.
>
> If you don't have the .git folder the replacement fails silently and the
> server console looks like this:
>
> :: version 2.21.8-SNAPSHOT :: commit @git.commit.id.abbrev@ ::
>
> We definitely want the git SHA, but in CI, we should be able to get it
> another way. If we had it, we could replace @git.commit.id.abbrev@ using
> sed instead, and no longer need the massive .git directory in our docker
> context.
>
> When this issue is finished, !.git will no longer be in the .dockerignore
> file
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/issues/3224>, or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAXOYAXOWHWPVYXUPYPY6B3SI3NQRANCNFSM4SCQKLQQ>
> .
>
I intentionally didn't refactor the `Dockerfile.release` file, as I'd like to address that independently

This thing is paying off :-) Running the tests locally, it reveals some deprecated usage already:

```
java.lang.AssertionError: 
Expecting empty but was:<"{"cluster_settings":[],"node_settings":[{"level":"critical","message":"setting [xpack.monitoring.enabled] is deprecated and will be removed in the next major version","url":"https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/7.8/breaking-changes-7.8.html#deprecate-basic-license-feature-enabled","details":"the setting [xpack.monitoring.enabled] is currently set to [false], remove this setting (nodes impacted: [zipkin-elasticsearch])"}],"index_settings":{},"ml_settings":[]}">
```

And `ITElasticSearchStorageV6`  

```
Detected usage of deprecated API for request HeaderOverridingHttpRequest{[:method=GET, :path=/_template/zipkin-test:span_template, :scheme=http, :authority=localhost:32844]}:
299 Elasticsearch-6.8.10-537cb22 "[types removal] The parameter include_type_name should be explicitly specified in get template requests to prepare for 7.0. In 7.0 include_type_name will default to 'false', which means responses will omit the type name in mapping definitions."
```

Should i go ahead and attempt to fix these in the same PR ?

1. `xpack.monitoring.enabled` will be removed. Binaries having a Basic licenses will just have the feature turned on, OSS ones don't have it: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/monitoring-settings.html#general-monitoring-settings
2. `include_type_name` is like your escape hatch to keep mapping requests working like before the type removal. With 8.0 at the latest you will have to support calls without types though. https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/6.8/indices-put-mapping.html#_skipping_types_3 has a warning for indices created with 5.x — not sure if that is a concern for you. But for 6.x and 7.x this shouldn't be an issue (though anything before 6.8 is starting to be an old memory, so take any advice there with care).

Thanks @Tibor17 

Just to understand as I see SUREFIRE-1831 is closed. We would expect to permanently set useModulePath to false, correct, vs wait for a later release which could obviate that. Trying to understand if this is a workaround or a permanent setting iotw.

found a less engineering way, considering dockerhub defaults to shallow clones per https://docs.docker.com/docker-hub/builds/advanced/#source-repository--branch-clones

https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/pull/3227

Thanks for giving this a try, though probably could have saved you effort to [chat](https://gitter.im/openzipkin/zipkin) first.

TL'DR'  a straight port of the MySQL v1 schema won't be accepted in the main project.

It is enough burden to maintain that, and even that should be ported to a more current design if we had more time. Making a similar copy in a different database flavor adds to the tech debt burden while still not giving a reasonable schema to end users.

Some notes copied here for convenience on the topic:
> work here needs champions to run it through. If you like, you can look at
the work-on-progress voltdb experiment as an example, though in the schema
likely completing normalization of the data is preferred (unclear on this
really)
> https://github.com/adriancole/zipkin-voltdb

https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/issues/1232#issuecomment-462544544


>> Came across this :
>>
>>  https://github.com/IAMTJW/zipkin/tree/master/zipkin-storage/postgresql
>> 
>> Any chance of this getting merged(accepted) ?
>
> first, the author would need to volunteer to contribute the code.
> technically though, this looks like a port of the mysql code, which isn't a
> good schema to emulate. so, in its form I dont expect that specific code to
> be merged.
https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/issues/1232#issuecomment-467460732
Anyway it was my needs :)

```

after

openzipkin/zipkin-builder   latest              50c1ed3cea36        2 hours ago         567MB
```

I can confirm that changing the browser to Chrome fixes the issue. I also removed the single span traces and see the empty list, so I believe that this issue goes beyond single span traces. Finally, and maybe this should be a separate issue, the dependencies suffer from the same problem.

Closing as no more feedback received. If you feel this is still relevant for your site, feel free to reopen and raise a PR, as it's unlikely to get addressed by the Zipkin community.

Only warning left now is about the `catch-all` template using index-pattern `*`, can something be done about this ? @adriancole

299 Elasticsearch-7.8.1-b5ca9c58fb664ca8bf9e4057fc229b3396bf3a89 "index template [catch-all] has index patterns [*] matching patterns from existing older templates [zipkin-test-span_template,.monitoring-es,.transform-internal-005,.monitoring-kibana,.logstash-management,.monitoring-logstash,ilm-history,zipkin-test-dependency_template,zipkin-test-autocomplete_template,.slm-history,.monitoring-beats,.monitoring-alerts-7,.transform-notifications-000002] with patterns (zipkin-test-span_template => [zipkin-test-span-*],.monitoring-es => [.monitoring-es-7-*],.transform-internal-005 => [.transform-internal-005],.monitoring-kibana => [.monitoring-kibana-7-*],.logstash-management => [.logstash],.monitoring-logstash => [.monitoring-logstash-7-*],ilm-history => [ilm-history-2*],zipkin-test-dependency_template => [zipkin-test-dependency-*],zipkin-test-autocomplete_template => [zipkin-test-autocomplete-*],.slm-history => [.slm-history-2*],.monitoring-beats => [.monitoring-beats-7-*],.monitoring-alerts-7 => [.monitoring-alerts-7],.transform-notifications-000002 => [.transform-notifications-*]); this template [catch-all] will take precedence during new index creation"
`

I think you are running into https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/pull/54367

maybe there's an auto-configuration (or property) we can disable and revert the log exclusion? cc @minwoox

https://armeria.dev/docs/server-docservice#including-and-excluding-service-methods
@adriancole PTAL

In fact, `DocService` just logs the plugins it has scanned at loadtime, doesn't mean it is actually active https://github.com/line/armeria/blob/a0180359e92fb80101dc3d04e178db845077afc3/core/src/main/java/com/linecorp/armeria/server/docs/DocService.java#L100

Not much that can be done, except asking Armeria if that logging line is really needed ?
since they are already pinged here, I'll leave it. thanks for the close look

I can't give you too much information. I have tried testing yours code and got an error that made it impossible to create the "prom" datasource. Reviewing the script, I saw that it was trying to create the datasource if it did not exist, but that it was checking if there was a dashboard "prom" instead of a datasource "prom". I have not created any dashboard called "prom" at any time.

I don't think this is needed. If you try from docker/examples directory `docker-compose up` then go to http://localhost:3000 you can see the dashboard loaded fine. Note: this intends to load the dashboard the zipkin team created.

I just tried it with some example

 traffic.

@minwoox maybe this can be debug? usually lower level things like this aren't worth bothering everyone about
We usually use info level for the logs in static initializers but let me discuss with others. cc @trustin, @ikhoon
I will try to make a test

Armeria logs the basic information required for understanding how it's configured at INFO level. I don't think we're going to lower to DEBUG because we log more dev-centric stuff at DEBUG level already. How about just setting the log level to WARN for `com.linecorp.armeria`?

do you consider the loading of a serialization provider "basic information required for understanding"?

it seems misplaced imho, meanwhile we've already silenced the logger or @jorgheymans did heh
Ah yeah, we could log them at DEBUG level but I guess we still should log what modules were loaded, e.g. `Available modules: brave, grpc, ...`. /cc @minwoox

when setting this finally got more details..

```xml
      <plugin>
        <artifactId>maven-surefire-plugin</artifactId>
        <version>${maven-failsafe-plugin.version}</version>
        <configuration>
          <!-- Ensures root cause ends up in the console -->
          <trimStackTrace>false</trimStackTrace>
        </configuration>
      </plugin>
```

Let me change to send the response after the service gets the request fully. 😅
CI failed with the same cause in another test. 😅  Let me fix that too, after lunch. 😄
can you paste the results of the endpoint `/api/v2/traces`?

Hi,

This seems to be more of a food-for-thought issue raised at the time when async spans were not yet first-class in the zipkin model or UI. 

Nowadays, if you look at spring-cloud Sleuth for example, if you have an `@Async` service invocation it will create a span named `async` automatically and nest everything happening in that invocation below it by default. In the UI it looks like this then:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/193792/96350575-c3342980-10b6-11eb-9c7a-d6c4f290fd93.png)

Ofcourse, if you'ld rather have the async operation as a separate trace you can disable this behaviour and set a key as annotation in both traces for correlation purposes if still needed.

All this just to illustrate that async spans can be tracked in the different ways like is described in this issue, but that it is up to the instrumentor to decide how. Closing this, if you feel that async spans should be somehow still be modeled more prominently or in a different way improving the current impl feel free to raise a separate issue with your suggestion !
It's been a while, closing as no more discussion happened around this. @adriancole if you want to add a conclusion how this is handled currently feel free, if not relevant anymore just ignore :-)

Even though the concerns raised here probably are relevant, I am closing this issue as it's approaching its 5 year anniversary and nobody else has been bothered by this. As always, feel free to raise a PR if you feel strongly about this, make sure to hop on our gitter channel https://gitter.im/openzipkin/zipkin beforehand to discuss the proposed design changes. Thanks !

If yes i can search around the issues and put up some 'hints' in the documentation like above, as well as a warning about the provided Cassandra schema that sites should really not rely on the 'demo' schema configuration we provide. We should not become Cassandra tweaking experts though, merely hint that sites are responsible for squeezing the most out of their storage, and we'll just tell them what is important in terms of zipkin storage and indexing needs.

If not and all this is hopelessly outdated, feel free to close :-)
